result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Felix III

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Cases 22CF660, 22CM563 are called at 9:47 AM) Defendant Richard J Felix III in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Richard J Felix III.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF660. Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant- 22CM563 to ride along.

9:47 AM cases 22CF660, 22CM563 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard J Felix III not in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Richard J Felix III. Defendant advised his attorney he would not be able to attend today. Defendant ordered to be Fingerprinted.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM cases 22CM563 and 22CF660 called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard J Felix III appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Ryan Kohler. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint in both files and time limits for the preliminary hearing in the felony file. Warrant is quashed in 22CF660. Both files: Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7-25-22 at 1:45 PM.
Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
